sentences.sContent: Many buildings were demolished by a hurricane.
sentences.sContent_eng: Many buildings were demolished by a hurricane.

sentences.sContent: Many coastal towns were desolated by the hurricane.
sentences.sContent_eng: Many coastal towns were desolated by the hurricane.
sentences.sCn: 许多沿海城镇遭到飓风袭击而荒芜。

sentences.sContent: That means the water in one hurricane weighs more than all the elephants on the planet. Perhaps even more than all the elephants that have ever lived on the planet.
sentences.sContent_eng: That means the water in one hurricane weighs more than all the elephants on the planet. Perhaps even more than all the elephants that have ever lived on the planet.
sentences.sCn: 这就意味着飓风中所含的水比地球上所有的大象加到一起还要重，也许会超过地球上曾经有过的所有大象体重的总和。

phrases.pCn: n. 防风灯；飓风灯；马灯

remMethod.val: hurri(看作hurry， 匆忙) ＋ cane → 来得很匆忙的风 → 飓风

trans.tranOther: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water
